# Automated Hydrothermal Hydrolysis System

## Tender Announcement

### Reference
* Number: cb-174-30559981
* Amendment Number: 4
* Solicitation Number: 925216
* Publication Date: 2023-10-04
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-10-17T14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2023-10-17
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-10-18
* Expected Contract End Date: 2023-12-31

### Description

The National Research Council (NRC) requires an automated Hydrothermal Hydrolysis System to enhance the utilization of existing laboratory equipment and support strategic research focus areas in aquaculture nutrition and waste valorization. The system must perform fat determination analysis in the measurement range of 0.1-100% and meet the following requirements:

* Commence digestion and filtration process in a closed system without hot rooms or ventilation.
* Have sensors to monitor and adjust temperature, cooling water, dosing, and concentration automatically.
* Process 1 g to 20 g of solids and up to 50 ml of liquid samples, for a wide range of biomass types.
* Digest six samples simultaneously with treatment cycle times of less than 90 minutes.
* Meet the international standards for fat determination and safety.

### Procurement

* This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* The procurement is not a set-aside for an Aboriginal supplier in accordance with the Procurement Strategy for Aboriginal Business (PSAB).
* Exclusions and/or Limited Tendering Reasons: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) – Article 513 (1) (b) (iii): Due to an absence of competition for technical reasons.

### Statement of Capabilities

Suppliers may submit a statement of capabilities demonstrating how their product/equipment/system meets the advertised requirements. The statement must be submitted in writing to the contact person on or before October 17th, 2023. The contact information is as follows:

Johnathon Gillis,
Phone: 343-552-4124,
Email: [johnathon.gillis@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:johnathon.gillis@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca),
Address: 1200 Montreal Road, Ottawa, Ontario K1A 0R6.

### Evaluation and Contract Award

Evaluation will be based on the assessment criteria and minimum essential requirements outlined in this document. The procurement is subject to the Government Contracts Regulations.
